page.title: 03LOCAL QUARRY
page.content: DOUGLAS MUIR QUARRY. The sand and gravel in Douglas Muir Quarry was discovered in 197O but the quarry did not open till 1973.It cost Â£1 250 000 to set up the machinery. Solid sand and gravel are dug up and have to be crushed in the quarry machinery. Before a load goes out by lorry it is weighed on the weigh bridge.17 people are employed.Building merchants, concrete makers and the public are the people who buy the products.The sand and gravel came there because in the ice age a glacier had pushed it there and left it when the ice began to melt,perhaps 10 000 years ago.
